intro: Erigeron stanselliae, commonly known as the Stewart's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small white or pale yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron stanselliae is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
